intro: Uragoga muelleriana, commonly known as the Mueller's uragoga, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Myrtaceae family and is characterized by its aromatic leaves and showy white to pink flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal regions and is adapted to sandy soils. It is often found in heathlands and is known for its ecological importance to local wildlife. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and threatened species.
